website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ70 packs a long zoom and an attractive price tag, but omits some of the refinements found on pricier models.
pros: Good image detail at high ISOs
cons: Rear LCD and EVF could be sharper

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to completely relearn how to use a camera.
customer_reviews.text: There is no doubt in my mind that this camera is capable of taking great pictures. I hate to put myself down, but I just didn't have the patience for this kind of interface. I got spoiled rotten by nikon coolpix and even moved up to an actual DSLR. I thought that a DSLR was difficult to learn how to operate. Then I got this camera. If you think this is a simple point and shoot? Think again. Kudos to those who found this camera to be easy. Go out...and make the world a better place!
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing sharpness and image quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall good camera. But sharpness lacks significantly compared to other Lumix models (i.e. Panasonic Lumix ZS70). This camera has a very large zoom (which is why I bought it for) which is almost useless because to take good shots that requires high shutter speeds which in in turn require either very bright light or very high ISO values. The electronic image stabilization is not worth the powder to blow it up with. Other cameras do a much better job. I had high hopes for this camera but was thoroughly disappointed. I am selling this camera as fast as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Claus W.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Focus especially When Using Zoom
customer_reviews.text: I have owned every new model of this camera for about the last 10 years and always loved the camera. When I saw that this newest model came out and had WiFi, I of course upgraded. I miss my old Panasonic! The focus on this camera makes it almost unusable for us and we are looking at other brands to replace it. Wow! So disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: CR Mom

customer_reviews.title: WAY TO COMPLICATED
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS FOR EXPERIENCED PEOPLE. SUPER FRUSTRATING FOR THE AVERAGE PERSON. EVERYTHING IS WAY TO HIGH RES SAVING VIDEO FILES ARE HUGE AND YOU CAN'T GET THEM DOWN THAT SMALL. PICTURES ARE 4K AGAIN SUPER HIGH RES. I WAS LOOKING TO FILM AT LOW RES BUT I CAN'T FIND ANYTHING THAT WILL DO THAT. JUST TOO MUCH CAMERA FOR THE "REGULAR PERSON" TRYING TO VIDEO A FEW MINUTES OF TRAINING. WISH IT WOULD BE SIMPLE TO OPERATE.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I wanted more performance than my iPhone without dropping a ton of money into a heavy camera that wouldn’t be practical for carrying on hikes. I’m just a little over a month into getting to know this camera and I couldn’t be more impressed. I’m attaching a few photos to show the experience I’ve had using this camera to date.
customer_reviews.author: Max Pickelsimer

customer_reviews.title: and I would say I absolutely love it! The versatility of this camera is definitely ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for almost 2 months now, and I would say I absolutely love it! The versatility of this camera is definitely the reason for purchasing it. Excellent macro and telephoto performances, this can be your all-in-one camera.Though the plastic material does make it feel kind cheap, it feels great when you actually hold it. Don't have too much expectation on the overall image quality, it only has a 1/2.3 inch sensor, but it's good enough for daily use or sharing it on instagram. Overall, with this price, this is definitely one of the best deals that you can get for a bridgecamera.
customer_reviews.author: ZG

customer_reviews.title: Such a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this camera. I was looking for a step up from my Canon Powershot pocket-sized point and shoot, but a step down from my bulky DSLR. The camera is just awful. There's so many settings and yet even in manual I've got noise, blur, etc. I was hoping for great clear photos of my kids but so far I've gotten barely any. I regret spending so much on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Anne B

customer_reviews.title: Not the best built
customer_reviews.text: I had an old FZ150 I used for micro work for my 1,000s of web-site photos, it lasted 8 years ? or more,. but after a drop, it would no longer focus. I bought this FZ80 to replace it, after 2 days of using it , I am returning it, the view finder is to small, the pictures are not crisp and the focus if not great and iI feel it is not made well enough for the Lumix name brand. I have ordered a FZ300 in hopes it is better built . 3 stars I want better pictures and better built then this model.
customer_reviews.author: Martha A. Hurd Call

customer_reviews.title: Not as Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as main camera for my Z47 and I was disappointed. It has a shooting in raw which I would like to have but the camera took pictures that were blurry. I tried every setting possible to correct this and nothing worked. the shutter speed was way to slow and it was hard to change the f stop. After using it for several days I gave up, My Z47 is much better and has everything I need except the RAW feature. Because I was so disappointed I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: lettledarlin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing zoom, amazing wide angle lens and all around great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera with an incredible zoom. I use this daily for interior home photos, as it has an excellent wide angle lens allowing for most of the room to be captured and is also great for taking sports photos AND video. This is the best camera I've ever owned. Attached is just a sample of the zoom capability.
customer_reviews.author: Campside

customer_reviews.title: Found the super zoom to be very grainy and unusable
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit more complicated to use than I wanted. I had to read the entire booklet to figure it all out. Even after figuring out the camera I had difficulty getting a decent quality photo out of it. Most pics were grainy unless just the right lighting and zoom were used. Found the super zoom to be very grainy and unusable. Maybe was too complicated or it may have been defective because I have heard good things about this camera. Customer service was good and I received my refund quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Eh.. its ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: This camera has alot of features and a long zoom for the money. It may have too many features for most users and photos while using the long zoom are grainy. Alot of photos came out blurry as well unless on a tripod. Granted, Im an amateur and just want to point and shoot but there is a setting for that and still got blurry photos and grainy zoom photos. I would say for the average point and shoot user, look elsewhere. If you really know your cameras and are a pro at alot of indepth settings, then this wouldn't be a bad buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. in Omaha

customer_reviews.title: Immensely improved my picture taking ability
customer_reviews.text: This camera works far better than I expected. Literally just point and shoot for great pictures. I decided to try the Moon shot because it should be very difficult to hold the camera steady. The moon picture on Aug 4 2014 was not done with a tripod. Think I might have a typo and put the 14th instead of the 4th but the picture is what is important. It came out very sharp for a maximum zoom picture without a tripod. I will absolutely recommend this camera to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: K Guillory

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected...
customer_reviews.text: It's going to take me a lifetime to learn all the features of this camera. Happily, there are some easy point and shoot/ scene options. I bought the camera for versatility, to photograph wildlife, festivals, and do some macro photography of insects and flowers. Every time I use the camera I discover more potential.... and that I'm probably not using the camera to it's fullest potential. This camera definitely isn't a drop it in your purse and take a few casual photos type camera. Yet it's also not something you only pull out when your doing serious photography. Instead, it's a great mix.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for novice.
customer_reviews.text: I'm no camera guy at all.Just wanted something to do and I love nature. Watched camera price.Read reviews. When price dropped I bought it. I'm still learning how to use.But so far.Most of the images have met my expectations. The ones that dont are my own fault.Camera is reasonably compact.Holds a charge fairly well. Easy to blue tooth to phone.Zoom is excellent. Still have a lot to learn.But as a total novice I dont regret this purchse.
customer_reviews.author: bgood

customer_reviews.title: Runty size
customer_reviews.text: For a camera with such a large zoom, you would think the body would be sized for two handed operation, but the left side of the body has little or no lip to grasp the camera without obscuring the LCD screen. I bought a leather case which extends the sides of the camera slightly, allowing for better two handed grip when using. Other then that the professional reviews align with my findings and use. Quick auto focus in good light and price point.
customer_reviews.author: holson

customer_reviews.title: What I like: The X60 zoom is amazing and rare
customer_reviews.text: What I like: The X60 zoom is amazing and rare; the camera is relatively light for easy travel; can do some manual settings and raw images. What I don't like: When zooming far way, need to zoom in gradually to establish focus, else would get out of focus. Also, when zooming in low light, the auto shutter speed is slow, causing blurring images. For example, in events with professional lighting, such as a big concert, I could take decent pictures of the lit stage from very far away. However, for indoor events with no professional lighting, such as school events, zooming from far away would likely have blurry pictures, unless I try to snap only when everyone is still.
customer_reviews.author: TLe

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for birds and wildlife
customer_reviews.text: The zoom is the best feature, since I use the camera for birdwatching. I've owned several of them, as I am tough on cameras and take tens of thousands of pictures. The battery life is another strong point. The only drawback, and it doesn't apply to the current one, is that the zoom function can wear out with hard use. I put the camera to extremes, and eventually the zoom will catch and a message will appear to say to turn the camera off and back on. Treat the camera carefully and you won't have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Geotripper

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I am 99% a point-and-shoot guy who doesn't want to remember details but does want a massive zoom. This camera scores on both counts. We left on a trip the day after it arrived and I thoughtfully left my instruction booklet behind. Still figured it out and captured great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Ed in MN

customer_reviews.title: Fine camera for the improving amateur
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked Panasonic P&S cameras because of their Leica lenses. This one is even better. Excellent zoom range, beginning at 24mm (35mm equivalent) which gives a true wide-angle perspective, out to a length no one has any business using without a tripod anyway. But under ordinary use, the image stabilization works well, and it's lower light (higher ISO) performance is no better or worse than any competitor. Got it for a trip with my 13 year old, who'd been only acquainted with cell phone cameras before. She still has it, but still prefers her (upgraded) cell phone for taking pictures. Sigh. But it's still a good camera, in between cell phone photography and my DSLR preferences.
customer_reviews.author: RBY

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous zoom
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for a trip to Alaska. The zoom allowed me to get pictures I couldn’t have dreamed of with my other cameras. The attached pictures were hand held from a boat, bus or roadside stop during overcast days shooting hundreds of feet away. Not gallery quality by any means but great remembrances. Given decent lighting, a tripod and someone with more camera savvy there’s no telling how good they could be. Excellent value, couldn’t have asked for more considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Stopped functioning well after 8 months; got fixed and no longer works.
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked fine for the first 8 months I had it. Then it started doing weird stuff. I sent it back to Panasonic and since I got it back it has given me problems. I've had someone more expert than myself trying to get it working right and we finally decided the camera is in worse shape than before it was "fixed". Now the front dial is not functioning; I can't shoot one shot at a time; the burst shots are blurry; and photos are grainy. The only setting I can use with any success is C. I am very disappointed as I loved my Fz24 and wanted RAW capabilities and a longer zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: So nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've never had my own real camera like this and I'm obsessed! Normal pictures are so nice, the zoom is awesome (the mon was a zoom in as much as possible)! I'm a beginner so I'm still trying to learn all the features. I was able to send the photos to my phone through wifi. When I looked on here under people's questions they said you couldn't do that, but when I read the actual user guide that it came with it explained how to do it. I love this camera :) I didn't need some super professional extreme quality camera so this is perfect enough for me! I put pictures of our kitty with and without the flash
customer_reviews.author: Erika B.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great deal for the price. It packs many features into a small form factor. It's a perfect travel camera and hobbyist camera. Or it's great for the DSLR shooting just to have single package with options and not have to worry about changing lenses. Yes, pixel peepers can pick it apart, but most won't notice many flaws. For photo shooters, it's easy to use and offers up a massive zoom with very nice quality images. For video shooters, you can shoot 4K, great HD, and the built in mic is pretty nice. This is not a GH5 and it's not trying to be.
customer_reviews.author: BMovieFan

customer_reviews.title: There are easier options
customer_reviews.text: I am not very happy with the technology in this camera. There is no blue tooth, the connection to WiFi is indirect and the instructions are difficult to translate.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Decent camera good. BUT NO CLEAN HDMI OUTPUT FOR STREAMING
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Decent for the price + Decent features Cons: + There is an HDMI port, but there is NOT CLEAN HDMI OUT for Streaming. This is killing the product and leads me to return it. If you are looking for a streaming camera, look somewhere else. FZ300 FZ1000 are a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera
customer_reviews.text: This would be my second panasonic camera. Don't get me wrong, I desperately wanted the fancy Rebel T6 camera but wasn't quite ready to spend that much money, plus money for lenses. This one comes with a fixie lens (meaning you can't change it out) but the zoom is pretty dope. It also has a macro setting, for those of you that like up-close shots. It has lots of features I still haven't figured out, but my friend who owns a Canon thinks it's pretty cool since it has a few settings that his $800 camera doesn't have. So if you're looking for something to begin with for photography, or getting REALLY good quality images, check this camera out.
customer_reviews.author: Laurette Maya

customer_reviews.title: Affordable bridge camera with loads of features and excellent overall rating from the professionals
customer_reviews.text: If you do not need a DSLR camera and want a very good general all round camera for nature or sport photography, the Lumix FZ80 is one of the best. The price for what you get is also very attractive. Use of the program is also easy to follow and understand. Image stabilization for a 60X zoom is amazing, shake free pictures can be taken at maximum zoom if one has a reasonably steady hand. The only improvement I would have liked is to have the camera splash resistant, but that would of course add to the price.
customer_reviews.author: Helmut Serapins

customer_reviews.title: I really LIKE This Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera's photo quality actually surprised me because the long zoom range. But the photos are better than expected - not professional, but this isn't a professional camera. It's pretty easy to understand and work. I am having some trouble with the image sliding around in my view finder when I zoom in on a subject. I get it steady, but it seems to bounce up and down on it's own and I can't make it stop. It's a crazy long zoom too! But it looses quality like crazy too with the long zoom. Nice wide angle though. Overall, I really like this camera and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lantana

customer_reviews.title: Fast looker, slow performances
customer_reviews.text: The camera was OK, it had some very good qualities, and some very average ones too. Overall fit and form is good, high impact plastic body makes it a little sketchy, could easily break. Lens was very good! Zoom was great until last part, very long zooms seemed pixelated. Shutter speed and response time for CCD writes are SLOW, too much time elapsed before camera was ready to take another photo. In compensation for slower speeds video recording seems BETTER, color brighter, images sharper. Gave up trying to capture wild birds at feeder. Lens was great for reaching out, but poor on auto focus and light gathering, probably because of low lens aperture speed.
customer_reviews.author: Walker Watson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing zoom
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes amazing handheld shots while zoomed all the way out.
customer_reviews.author: Samaron

customer_reviews.title: 60x zoom under $300 - great value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera just for the 60x zoom. I used it especially to take pictures of the moon. The camera has good features. Pro: all the Lumix values, switch betwen LVF & LCD view under bright day light, take 55mm filter (leverage all my old Minolta 55mm filters). Wish: The shutter only goes to 1/2000. I wish it can be one step faster. Most of the attached photo are taken w yellow filter; one photo is taken w creative art filter.
customer_reviews.author: Young

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little super zoom
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great Raw files can be pushed pretty far. The manual mode gives you some guidelines for what settings make the most sense, great for a beginner. Id buy it again, this camera got me started and I still use it from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, nice price
customer_reviews.text: After comparing the bigger brands, this camera offered more features at a lower cost. The 60x optical zoom is a very nice feature. The camera is very easy to use, make taking quick pictures much simpler and the image quality is far superior to my fruit-branded cell phone's camera. The colors are far more realistic. I bought this camera for taking pics of products for selling on eBay. The camera works great for this and provides tons of features for using it everywhere else. I bought some extra batteries and an external charger to go along with this. Now I can go on a road trip and never run out of battery juice for my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Raudi

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera and I use it for my real ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camera and I use it for my real estate photos.....wide enough angle lens and very clear photos! Great camera!! Much easier to use than my DSL.....I don't even use the DSL anymore. You won't regret buying this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: One of the best, if not THE best "bridge" of cameras for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great zoom power. Large aperture which allows allows hand held shots at full zoom and use of filters that reduce one stop or more. Multipoint focus tech' which means shots where there is a lot of sky in the center, the focus defaults to infinity, which is preferred. Cons: Bright red objects (flowers, etc.) in the frame tend to saturate -- I'm working on that.
customer_reviews.author: ezmuny

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: If you like zoom camera I recommend this for you. I honestly tell you that I love this camera. Why? Because the reviews on YouTube are true in real life and it is lovable plus light weight. The only thing that it needs improvement was the battery because it's only takes around 30 minutes of continuous video taking. But for the price is a win win situation because it is fully packed with features. You will never regret it. Though low light condition is kind of grainy but with a bit of edit will heal the problem. 5⭐️
customer_reviews.author: I WANT THE TRUTH!!!

customer_reviews.title: Good value in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I just take pictures for my own use. This camera gives me great pictures. The image stability for video and high magnification (zoom) is very good. I took still and video at a robotics world competition at Cobo Hall in Detroit. This was an indoor arena with good lighting. I took many pictures and video of fast moving robots. The images were sharp with great color. That was done with auto plus and 3 exposures per shot (-2/3, 0, 2/3). Usually the zero was the best, but a few times one of the other was slightly better (nice). Very happy with this camera and it cost half of what my previous SLR cost.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S. Basberg

customer_reviews.title: The Zoom is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Normally, I do not like to carry a lot with me when I travel. I preferred to use my cell phone for taking pictures. And I tried many difference add on zoom lens for my iPhone. But none of them really work and some of them are not cheap either. With the Lumix FZ80, it might not have the best resolution but the 60X is really amazing. I can capture things really far away. Now I can take picture of birds without getting too close. The only thing is it does take time for the image to get stabilized. Comparing to expensive and heavy zoom lens, this is the best alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Yuen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this camera. It really zooms in and gets great pictures. We used it at my daughter's wedding and got some great shots, including a gorgeous night picture. Very happy and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sometimes I Use it

customer_reviews.title: Only charged for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for our 50th Anniversary cruise to Alaska. It performed very well......on the cruise. Once I got home, however, it never charged again. Now I can't even get the Alaska pics! :-( I will also have to learn how to utilize more of the functions, but that's not the manufacturer's fault. I note that Manufacturer did respond to other's comments. Hope I hear from them UPDATE:: Panasonic corrected the problem immediately. Full disclosure requires that I rerated the camera and all is now well. Thanks very much for Panasonic's response and customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Norv

customer_reviews.title: Okay Camera But Don't expect too much
customer_reviews.text: After several months of shooting daytime and other full light shots with this super zoom camera I decided to take it on a two week tour in Europe- primarily because it weighs about a pound less than my Nikon. The days there were mostly cloudy and overcast. While the full sun shots were still good, I think overall the quality of the shots were below average and somewere downright awful. The camera disappointed me with anything less than full sun.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Advocate NC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Features
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed when the camera arrived. I am usually a point and shoot type person so it is all a little overwhelming to me right now. There are so many features and choices. Once I finally figure everything out I think it will be a great camera. I have used a simpler version of the Panasonic Lumix for years and have always received compliments on the great pictures it took. Hope this one will provide the same quality photos. I was impressed with the reviews of others..
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a camera as an aid to birdwatching. Something that would help me capture decent images in the field for those (many) times I am completely stumped on IDing a bird. This has allowed me to get some very good captures of tiny shorebirds some distance away, for studying on my tablet when I get home. The autofocus works very well, though it struggles in lower light situations. Up to this point, I’ve mostly just used the autofocus feature. Will my pics win any photography awards? No. But they are good enough to help me learn bird ID, and to share with friends on social media.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated!
customer_reviews.text: I can't do anything with this camera. I admit, I am a technophobe, but not an idiot. At one time, I knew all about F-stop, asa, depth of field, exposure, etc. on the old fashioned cameras. I have a Panasonic Lumix that is much older and simpler, and used it for years. I wanted to up my game, but this camera is so complicated that I have taken 3 lessons to learn about it, and I still haven't touched it since the final lesson. It it technically a good camera, but is too complicated for someone like me. I'm sorry I bought it. Wasted $300 because it's too much to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: think these pictures taken by me an amature!
customer_reviews.text: learning how to use this camera at 71 years old has been a boost to my outlook on life!
customer_reviews.author: D.W.F

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding battery life and a fine camera for birdwatching.
customer_reviews.text: The zoom range is amazing, from a wide 20mm, out to 1200mm. With this range, I'm using this camera like binoculars that can take photographs & videos. The pictures are gorgeous with fine details rendered nicely. The image stabilization works well, but you need to do your part by bracing yourself or use a tripod. This is probably the best camera for world travelers. It can hold thousands of photographs, around 3890 (raw format w/jpeg) on a 256 gigabyte sd card. This camera replaces my DMC-FZ35, may it rest in peace.
customer_reviews.author: kkrome25

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert of cameras by any means, but so far I love this camera. It was looking for a camera that was a point and shoot that takes good pictures in low light and this camera takes excellent nighttime pictures. Was also looking for a camera with a regular viewfinder when taking pictures outside in sunny situations as well as the LCD display viewfinder that seems to be the new normal for some reason. Takes much better pictures than phone cameras (Don't be fooled by commercials). Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: John l

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Memory Card Required To Use This Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera last week but didn't have time to set it up until today. I was very disappointed to see that you can't actually save photos or videos without a memory card that is not included with the camera. I'm not an expert on cameras. I imagine more experienced camera users know this but I just feel that this is highly dishonest and incredibly poor customer service to not make it abundantly clear to customers shelling out nearly three hundred dollars for a camera that there is an additional part needed that is not included.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great pictures!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous camera. I took it on a trip to Africa and got fabulous shots of both birds and animals. I many cases one would think I was standing right next to them. Just make sure stabilization is on for zoom shots. I just kept it on all the time and it worked beautifully. I got it shortly before my trip and did not get a chance to practice much. That did not seem to matter. I highly recommend this camera. The attached photos have been reduced in size for computer use.
customer_reviews.author: Kybeadnut

customer_reviews.title: Awful - not as good as the older models
customer_reviews.text: Images were worse than the prior model. Compared to a Nikon d3500 - the images were awful. The video was okay, but then if you zoom in or out you can hear the mechanical sound of the zoom. Returned because of that. Did not feel good in my hand - the camera body is very similar to others, again, nearly identical in feel to the Nikon D3500, but the images on the Nikon are much much better. I used to have a prior Lumix model - a point and shoot that was flat so you could put in your pocket. Not sure that one is still available, but that was better than this.
customer_reviews.author: new parents G

customer_reviews.title: Understand it's limitations and it will serve you well.
customer_reviews.text: Like most folks I was impressed on paper with the crazy long zoom on the FZ80. Just make sure you understand the limitations of that gargantuan zoom with a tiny sensor. It's capable of amazing results but only under a narrow band of conditions. I suggest looking at videos and books by Lumix maestro Graham Houghton for more info and ideas.
customer_reviews.author: IngersollTCF

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for people interested in upping their photo game.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to taking any semi professional photos. The extent of my camera knowledge extends to cell phone and go pro, which I've managed pretty well on. One thing I've missed using both of them is any kind of decent zoom. The FZ80 on the other hand will zoom for days. It's actually pretty incredible. This allows for all kinds of creative space to take photos of nature and wildlife. For the price I think it takes very detailed, clear pictures. The fast delivery was a bonus as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A VLOGGING OR STREAMINIG CAMERA - CANNOT USE IN CLASSROOM LEARNING
customer_reviews.text: While Panasonic does have a (Beta) teather software to a PC it DOES NOT include this camera. You can not make it include this camera. This looks like wonderful still camera with a little video capture on a card. Also, this camera will not charge and shoot at the same time. This is really necessary for 8 hour classroom training sessions. Suggest you move on to a different camera for live streaming. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Branson Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera!! 📷
customer_reviews.text: Wanted better pictures than a cell phone allows. Wanted enough zoom to take pics of kids in football games, or wildlife along the road. We use it in "auto" and the pics are awesome, and with the features this camera has (that we haven't used yet) I can only imagine what it's capable of!
customer_reviews.author: Greg honrud

customer_reviews.title: Great camera--highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a lot of cameras over the years, and this is by far my best and most versatile. The zoom to 60x is amazing! Does help to have a steady hand, adequate light and preferably a tripod, but you can get some shots that were impossible to get with a $400 cam a few years ago. In my opinion, it actually beats out DSLRs because you don't have carry extra lenses. The 20x wide angle is useful too. Have not investigated the other features, but I'm sure they'll come in handy later. Very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: lmc

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing! its super versatile and with a little knowledge ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! its super versatile and with a little knowledge about photography you can take amazing pictures. I also like that it shoots 4k. For the price point I dont think you can do better. While you could get the body of an entry level DSLR for the same price you would end up spending much more in lenses to get the same capability. The zoom on this camera is awesome as well. I would say if you are looking for a high quality low cost camera and dont want to deal with lugging around multiple lenses, this camera is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second camera. The first one lasted seven years and it finally had too many drops from my saddle bags while riding my horses. This camera is easy to use, great action photos, a wonderful zoom and is very durable!! I have small hands ands comfortable enough for me to use one handed while riding horses. I just took it on an eight day horseback adventure in Israel and dropped it at a full canter on hard ground. Not even a scratch!! It’s a great camera for the price!
customer_reviews.author: jss2004

customer_reviews.title: Superb digital camera from Panasonic
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from a 17-day vacation in Scandinavia, for which I purchased this new camera. It takes excellent photographs, and the 60x optical zoom is amazing. What is particularly surprising, and useful, is its ability to take great photos in dim light, without using the built-in flash; this was especially helpful in certain museum locations where flash was forbidden. It autofocuses very quickly as well. Sighting of the subject can be done by using the LCD screen (which is quite bright, even in bright sunlight) or, with the push of a button, through the small sighting slot just below the flash. The flash, incidentally, must be manually raised and lowered for use, but this is quite easy and quickly done.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Apfelzweig

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Eventually...
customer_reviews.text: I'll have the time to figure out how this works. I have yet to take a good picture with this camera. I got this because a reviews Website recommended it for Macro photography - big mistake. Not only can I not figure out how to do that, it barely takes even decent snapshots. My cell phone is better. Wish I didn't buy this and can't say I'd recommend it. It does have many features, so I suppose if you are willing to take the time to read all about it and watch tutorial videos or what have you, then maybe this isn't bad - but if you're looking for something more intuitive, I'd look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: ddavis

customer_reviews.title: Best mega zoom  camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been an avid photographer for a couple years and was in the market for a high zoom point and shoot camera and this one definitely did not disappoint it claims it has 1200 mm of optical zoom which it definitely does but there’s a hack that you can get over 4000 mm of zoom with this camera amazing for the price and the picture quality is great depending on the light and how far you are zoomed in with that being said I highly recommend this camera to any family anybody traveling or somebody that is looking into photography
customer_reviews.author: Chad sholly

customer_reviews.title: Well made, well thought out...
customer_reviews.text: This seems like an extremely well made and well thought out camera. I expect to almost always use it on the Intelligent Automatic setting and am mostly impressed with the way that the camera deals with difficult areas of contrast in the picture. I am also impressed with the ability to zoom all the way in on something in good light and still be able to get an acceptable photo without bracing myself or using a tripod. Obviously, bracing or use of a tripod would be better. But this is the test that all my friends wanted to try on the camera and everybody was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: Great macro shots, even better getting close up of distant items. I was able to take a picture of a rock in a waterfall that was several hundred feet away and it came out clear as a bell.
customer_reviews.author: D. Child

customer_reviews.title: He is an excellent photography and has always used Leica cameras
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Dad who is 84. He is an excellent photography and has always used Leica cameras. However he can't use his Leicas anymore because of a hand tremor. I selected the Panasonic because of its ability to control stability. My Dad is now into photography again and taking amazing shots with this camera. He is also getting into computers and digital photography at 84 because of this great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Jackson

customer_reviews.title: good image and not overly complicated
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to a friend as a gift so my review is based on the few images that I saw him take. He did not want an overly complicated camera - so it only took a few minutes to go over the things he would most commonly use. He sent me a few pictures of some projects he was working on and they looked like they were pretty good quality (I'm a professional photographer) at this price range. He said he likes it, so I guess that's what counts!
customer_reviews.author: dvdTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A Feature-Filled Bridge Camera
customer_reviews.text: Like most bridge cameras the FZ80 can be used in point and shoot mode, but that's just the beginning. It has a long 60X zoom lens, some wireless features, and can film in 4K. Using the camera can be daunting at first, but with patience and time, most people will get to discover all of its features. Better still, order the FZ 80 book written by Graham Houton, available on Amazon. He's a great help. He's produced good tutorials on Youtube, too.
customer_reviews.author: Bluepoint

customer_reviews.title: What a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about a camera with one lens with such a large zoom range, but I couldn't be happier with it! This camera allows me to capture great close ups without the hassle of changing lenses, and the quality is quite good for prints. I am a "nikon person", but I am selling my Nikon D3300. The convenience and quality of the Lumix beats the Nikon hands down. Awesome awesome awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Stewy

customer_reviews.title: Lumix... WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product and the seller is awesome! Item arrived quick, safe and sound. From the moment I grabbed the camera I could feel the quality and it does take awesome pictures. Focus is clear, exposure in automatic mode is spot on and the range of the lens makes it the perfect one camera does it all solution. I am going to sell my multi lens DSLR because this is a lot more convenient and with equal or better results. Extreme zoom situations best use tripod. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John Nornberg

customer_reviews.title: The view finder is a big plus!
customer_reviews.text: Love having a view finder again. Yes, I'm old school. Photos show normal focus (mammoth 1) and close ups of desk stuff and mammoth's eye. The clock was taken from a significant distance at maximum zoom. I like the weight and the selection features (priorities, video, movement, still) that allow significantly more control over photography than is normally found in such a camera. This is a very pleasant camera to use. I'd say a great vacation camera where you want to take better than just snap-shots but also don't want to haul around massive amounts of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Jack MO

customer_reviews.title: PANASONIC lUMIX fz80 4k Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera!! I wanted a zoom camera with a view finder plus a screen, that would not be too difficult to use. I am not a professional so it had to be easy yet take fabulous shots for my trip to Alaska this summer! I looked at a number of camera and am thrilled I chose this one!
customer_reviews.author: G. Magee

customer_reviews.title: A great everything camera below the pro needs.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera for everything. Maybe for a serious pro use you need a Nikon D5. Last Nikon I had was the D2. Got too expensive. I love the LUMIX lens and recently I shot a pic at about 22X right throwing the home Venetian blinds of an unusual formation in a distant tree. Focused perfectly on the object of interest with no blind showing. Great travel camera and easy to learn its intricacies. Can’t beat the lens either. While the sensor provides over 16 mp its is a small sensor, under 29 mm^2, about the same as an iPhone which makes very low light imaging subject to dark noise in the sensor.
customer_reviews.author: fiddler

customer_reviews.title: GREAT POINT & SHOOT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: The zoom is the main attraction to this camera. This is the third Lumix we have had and second FZ80. All have had 60 - 1200 zoom. The first FZ80 started having issues with the zoom about three years after we bought it. We travel alot and took close to 250,000 pictures if not more. We thought enough of the camera to purchase a second FZ80. At times I would like to have a manual lens to turn to focus, but not practical with a point & shoot. Just touch the screen on the object you want focused and it is done. Happy shooting and enjoy the zoom.
customer_reviews.author: chender

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMC-FZ70 meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I noticed that my iPhone was outperforming my Panasonic DMC-FZ100 by its' ability to stop a tennis ball in flight. The iPhone has a feature called HDR that permits better photos of rapidly moving objects. The DMC-FZ70 also has this ability. I tested it and it also stopped tennis balls in flight. I wanted this capability for sports pictures and because I have young grandchildren that seem to be in constant motion when I want a picture. I also wanted the telephoto ability for sports and wildlife photos. It would cost a small fortune to get the telephoto ability for a DSLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera and speedy.
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely an instamatic user, so when this came, I have been having a blast with all the choices I have. I would highly recommend watching the dvd that comes with the camera. The booklet is good, but very basic and this camera can do so MUCH. I love the telephoto lens, this camera pulls the birds right up to me.
customer_reviews.author: KL Mackay

customer_reviews.title: review by Larry Ponziani
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera have ever had. it uses a MOS sensor which is much more accurate and clear than CMOS that is used everywhere. (GOOGLE MOS VS CMOS). the 60x lens with image stabilization is amazing. you will hear the little stabilization motors running when it is zoomed out. it has great wide angle at the other end. the battery lasts way longer than any point and shoot. it has dozens of modes to shoot under. I bought a 64gig chip for it. Don't hesitate to get this camera. I did lots of research and comparisons and this one wins hands down. I am an electrical engineer ... total geek and nurd. larry ponziani
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ponziani

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Camera
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. It does everything well! This is a hybrid camera. It has the full functionality of an SLR, but the ease of use of a point and shoot. The ability to control the depth of field is taken to a level of simplicity that is genious (there is a wheel that is also a depressable button that changes control mode... aperture, shutter speed, etc.), allowing for "on the fly" control of the lens. Sometimes it seems a bit slow to focus on distant objects, but when it does, the optics prove they are excellent and the pictures of objects taken at high distance (even in low light) are amazing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Can’t be a pro. Tried to adjust lighting but pictures turned out unsatisfying. Poor quality. I regret buying this camera.
customer_reviews.author: AngelAmaz

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but a bit bulky for me
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best bridge cameras according to many reviews. It has a superzoom of 60X and is especially great for sky watchers and bird watchers. The only problem I had with it was that it was a little heavy and bulky for me. It may not be so for others but I am used to little point-and-shoot cameras like the ZS70 or ZS80 that have only 30X zoom power but can fit in my shirt pocket.
customer_reviews.author: ebassiri

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Camera!!!! Great for Starting youtubers!
customer_reviews.text: This has been my main youtube camera for pretty much a year now and the only reason I'm upgrading is because in the tech community its all about the video quality and I just needed to upgrade to a DSLR camera. But other than that I'd say that this is a really killer camera for the price. You can get some great photo and video out of this thing and it has killer zoom. 60X!!! So if you wanna see some photo and videos that this camera can produce go check out my youtube channel AppsOnFire for my camera test of this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Denzel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very p;oor planning.
customer_reviews.text: The camera comes with a USB cord that can only be used by the camera. The (laughably called cord) is all of 12 inches long. Who is the stupid engineer that came up with this?// I would just as soon have a separate charger. This has left me wondering just how chintzy the rest of the camera is. I am on the verger of returning it over this. What happens if the charging cord gets lost or damaged? How much will Panny charge for the replacement?/
customer_reviews.author: Chuck2

customer_reviews.title: Super Quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this on Friday and had it sitting on my front door step Saturday night. Luckily i got him when i did as the box had about an inch of snow on top of it. Was amazed that it was the camera we just barely ordered. I haven't taken a picture with this yet as im still waiting on my SD card to be delivered. The camera itself looks nice but the plastic used seems like a toy (cheap material) but no biggie that's not why i purchased it. im looking forward to playing and familiarizing myself with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Artz

customer_reviews.title: So Lightweight yet so Capable
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this light weight compact camera for traveling but it’s so good I’m using it instead of my DSLR (it’s so heavy). It doesn’t replace my Canon 70D, but I’m loving the convenience of having all the manual capabilities as my other camera. The touch screen rocks and it offers so many different setting options plus the biggest perk, the lens offers such a huge range, super strong zoom and an aperture as low as 2.8f, creative play time!
customer_reviews.author: Karina Rindt

customer_reviews.title: very difficult to use menus
customer_reviews.text: This is a very light weight camera with a great zoom. However, you can spend hours trying to solve problems to set functions to what you want. The menu in the camera is not all there is. Downloading the full manual would have helped if I could find the menu item in the camera to begin with! The menu is not at all intuitive and the places where settings are buried is very confusing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cromer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: This product didn’t last a year! It no longer holds a charge. Way too expensive for very little quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Klipp

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have an Audio jack, but takes great pics
customer_reviews.text: I also bought a "Shot Gun Microphone" with audio plug and that's when I noticed there is no audio receptor on the FZ80, so enhancing sound is not an option as far as I can see. Does anyone else have an Audio plug on their Lumix FZ80? and if not, what is the workaround? I gave it 3 stars, but still learning and will upgrade if I find the reason. (6-12-19 I upgraded to 4 stars) take great pics, the zoom is impressive when set right. So that could be the settings, there are many and I am still not sure of what combo is best.
customer_reviews.author: Bill DeStefano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first camera.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get into macro and bird photography but didn’t want to a spend thousands on the hobby. This is the best bang for buck camera to introduce yourself to photography. Day light is superb. That’s where I spend most of my shooting time but low light isn’t so bad either. The user interface for the camera is fast and easy to navigate once you learn it.
customer_reviews.author: Compile

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are LACKING.  A lot.
customer_reviews.text: Life's too short for this camera. I read the dinky instructions that never told me why my camera loves to record when I am taking a picture. I am a researcher, so I read articles, YouTube, and then fiddled. Intelligent fiddling because I own a Canon for a long time! I have decided I can either throw it at the wall (rewarding), or return it. Alas, it’s too expensive to for the rewarding option.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W. Mcclure

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera. Very much impressed with battery life
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Camera. Very much impressed with battery life. I have many cameras whose battery life lasts maximum 2 hours. But this camera's battery did not completely drain even after continuously recording video for 4 hours. Video is excellent. I love this camera. Highly recommend to others who are undecided about which camera they should buy. Price is also within $300 which is very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: RBG

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the price! I’ve been using this camera for the past 2-3 months and have really learned to love it! Taken so many pictures of the moon and birds around my place! I mainly purchased it for my sister graduation coming up so I can get a clear shot of her face when she is walking down the stage to receive her diploma!
customer_reviews.author: BloodyEnviouZ

customer_reviews.title: amazing zoom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I wanted something simple to use, that's basically a point and shoot, but with the ability to zoom and have high quality photos. I've been using it for wildlife photography and have gotten amazing shots of animals up in the canopy. The pictures are clear and crisp, even being zoomed in on from so far away. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stumpf

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my wife replacing a Panasonic Lumix point & shoot that she used for a number of years. She picked this one out and used it for the first time on a trip to the west coast. With virtually no practice or knowledge of what it is really capable of, she took some awesome pictures with it! Both long zoom shots of ocean waves crashing and portrait shots turned out great. Low light shots take some getting used to but the intelligent auto setting is really great most of the time!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: are not crisp when handheld but most are pretty good. When at a "reasonable" zoom they are ...
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying using this camera with the 60x zoom. Some photos, when zoomed to the max, are not crisp when handheld but most are pretty good. When at a "reasonable" zoom they are good. The only thing I don't like is the online manual. I'm not printing out 200+ pages and I like to read and experiment which I find hard to do online.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this camera after my previous Lumix fell off the table. I went to my local camera shop to see the different brands out there and liked this one. I went home to research it and was happy with the reviews. I found this cheaper at Amazon and purchased it. When I went on vacation recently, I enjoyed having this camera with me. The zoom is amazing and the picture quality was beautiful, I am no pro at taking pictures and I will probably never use all the functions but, this camera is incredible! I have tried uploading a picture 3 times to this review but it isn't working. This camera is definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Marie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am truly surprised with what this camera can do. 4K video at 30 FPS is a great feature to have that no other price points have even dared to include. Beautiful photos and the zoom is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Foreit

customer_reviews.title: Never a mishap or missed shot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a "Bucket List" trip to Yellowstone and the surrounding areas. I took over 1500 pix of landscapes and animals. This camera always came on and focused very quick. I took photos of 4 wolves close to 3/4 mile away. You can tell they're wolves. I have a slight shaking in my hands and the fz 70 even took Most of that out. INCREDIBLE SHOTS. Moving at 70mph. Low light. Long shots. Battery lasted over 500 shots. Close ups on flowers. The only glitch is when you're wanting to take a longer shot and the camera focuses on something closer, electric lines, leaves, etc. I usually could step one way or the other and problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Burning Springer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for macro photos!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good mid-range priced camera to photograph flies I tied for fly fishing. This camera takes fantastic standard and macro photos! Read the operations manual folks! This is a fantastic point and shoot camera 📷! Can't wait to do a 4k video!
customer_reviews.author: John Watson

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre $300 camera; terrible $5 strap
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke in 5 months. Not covered by warranty, though honestly they're probably doing you a favor, since you shouldn't trust it anyway. For most, I'd say buy yourself a $100 camera, or even just use your cell phone if you're not too concerned about a lot of zoom. If you're going digital, chances are good you won't need the $200 worth of bells and whistles I (over)paid for.
customer_reviews.author: RB428

customer_reviews.title: Shoot for the moon while saving a few bucks
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur photographer (like everyone who doesn't get paid for their photos). I have to say this is a pretty good camera. It packs a wallop when it comes to features and stands up on its own against more expensive options. The WiFi transfer is nice once you get it set up and allows you to send images directly to your google drive or any other device you might wish - but its still easier to just pop out the SD card and plug that into your computer or utilize the USB. The included picture was taken at maximum zoom on a tripod without a remote trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bond

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ordered when my 2nd FZ200 finally bit the dust...I thought I would try a different model. Some things are slightly different but overall, the same quality I have come to love from Panasonic. I do think there is a bit of a difference in the lens (Lumix vs Leica) but not enough to matter to most folks. Love the extra zoom...just use a tripod or be very steady. I am still learning how this particular camera works but in no time it will be an extension of my arm just as the previous ones were.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia G.

customer_reviews.title: Most Versatile Camera I have owned to Date!
customer_reviews.text: This particular camera gives you everything you need. Not everything great but definitely good enough. Good focus on stills, Easy Video w/4K, great zoom ability, Wi-Fi capability ( to share pictures with others), light weight, Close-up and Action options, Editing, Menu with several different setting to choose from (I'm still learning them all). If you don't want the heaviness of a DSLR with the versatility of always available zoom and quick switch capability to Video then this is the camera for you. I haven't missed shots like I use to with my Canon Rebel, great camera itself but sometime to too long to switch zoom lenses, find the right setting to shoot, and instantly ready for whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Torrance Benberry

product_meta.title: Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ70 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 60x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:FZ70FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Long Zoom Camera LeaderPanasonic LUMIX FZ70 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 60X Super Long Zoom and Dolby® Digital Sound

Life is more than a single moment captured in time. Never miss the action with an amazing Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ70 compact digital camera equipped with 20mm wide-angle to 1200mm (60X) long zoom F2.8-5.9 lens. Experience Full HD video with auto focus and an amazing wind shielded microphone that zooms with the camera to zero in on your subject’s audio. DMC-FZ70K 
Super Long Zoom Lens From 20mm Ultra Wide-Angle To 60x Optical Zoom At 60X optical zoom, the LUMIX FZ70 Point and Shot digital camera produces stunning versatility from ultra-wide 20mm to incredible 1200mm to capture dynamic landscapes, wildlife, and almost any travel scene. Capture a little extra zoom with Intelligent Resolution technology. Extend the zoom ratio up to 120X equivalent while maintaining superior picture quality.Amazingly Clear Zoom Microphone with Dolby® Digital Audio QualityRecording video with the Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ70 is easy, but what's really amazing is the camera's ability to capture crisp, clear audio. The videos are accompanied by realistic Dolby® Digital Stereo Creator. Sound quality is further improved with the LUMIX FZ70 and the newly developed Wind Shield Zoom Microphone.Create Stunning Movies With Full HD Video RecordingThe LUMIX FZ70 digital camera records Full-HD 1920 x 1080 videos in both AVCHD and MP4 format. A separate button on the top of the camera lets you instantly start recording videos while simultaneously shooting photos. The Creative Video Mode empowers you to adjust the shutter speed and aperture in videos to get the creative effect you are looking for.Power Optical Image Stabilization & Active Mode Deliver Sharp, Clear ImagesPOWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) suppresses hand-shake that causes blurred photos. Even slight hand-shake movement of this point and shot camera is accurately detected and compensated for to produce sharp, clear images. Panasonic LUMIX FZ70's Active Mode performs beautifully when recording wide-angle video at such as shooting while walking. The resulting videos are stable and clear.Be Inspired With In Camera Creative Controls and Creative RetouchPanasonic LUMIX FZ70 digital camera's Creative Control and Creative Retouch modes feature 15 filter effects. The Creative Control mode lets you shoot with a filter while checking how it looks on the picture. Certain filters can be used for video recording as well. The Creative Retouch mode lets you apply a filter on a picture, in camera, even after shooting.Expand Your Vision With Creative Panoramic EffectsCreative Panorama function shoots a horizontal/vertical panoramic image with consecutive shots by overlaying the previous picture. The multiple images are stitched together in the camera to create one single-wide image capturing your scene. Get creative with one of the 11 panoramic filter effects this long zoom camera offers.
NEVER MISS A SHOT EVEN WITH ACTION PHOTOGRAPHY
The LUMIX FZ70 takes your photography to the next level with blazing fast speeds of up to 5 fames per second (fps) AF or 2fps with continuous AF Tracking, keeping your subject in focus even while it moves. An even faster 3 frame burst at 9 fps helps lock in those fast moving, once in a lifetime moments. Click to See More

AMAZING LOW LIGHT 16.1-MEGAPIXEL HIGH SENSITIVITY MOS SENSOR
LUMIX FZ70's bright F2.8-5.9 lens with 16.1-megapixel High Sensitivity MOS sensor delivers phenomenal image quality in high-sensitivity shooting scenes. The camera's sensor cuts noise by about 10-15% and dramatically improves image quality vs. previous models. With the Venus Engine, this superb sensor elevates response, sensitivity, and image quality. Click to See More

SHOOT IMPRESSIVE PICTURES WITH IA (INTELLIGENT AUTO) / IA PLUS MODE
iA (Intelligent Auto) of FZ70 digital point and shot camera helps you make beautiful pictures with a variety of shooting-assist functions. The camera does all the work, leaving you free to compose shots and capture moments in both photos and videos. Adjust background focus, exposure compensation, and white balance for even more flexible control by simply moving the slider. Click to See More

PANASONIC LUMIX FZ70 PREMIUM ACCESSORIES
DMW-LA8 Lens Adapter
Get closer with the Tele Conversion Lens - DMW-LA8 Lens Adapter for the 1.7X DMW-LT55 Conversion Lens.DMW-LC55 Close-up 3X Filter
Discover the details with the DMW-LC55 Close-up 3X Filter.Panasonic DMW-FL360L External Flash
Panasonic DMW-FL360L TTL external flash gives you precise control of the light in your scene.Panasonic DMW-LPL55 Polarizer Filter
Polarizing technology to give you control of color saturation.
feature_bullets: Bring the action in super close with category class leading 60X optical zoom (20mm-1200mm)
Experience Full 1080/60i HD Panasonic Video recording with auto focus
Zoom focused Dolby quality sound recording locks out ambient noise for enhanced audio quality
Dimensions (W x H x D) 130.2 x 97.0 x 118.2 mm / (5.13 x 3.82 x 4.65 inch)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,833 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
